sections.description: **Tip:** Prefix a cursor movement command with a number to repeat it. For example, 4j moves down 4 lines.

codes.w: Move cursor at the beginning of a word
codes.b: Move cursor back at the beginning of a word
codes.e: Move cursor forward at the end of word
codes.^: Move cursor at the beginning of a line
codes.$: Move cursor at the end of line
codes.%: move to matching character (default supported pairs: '()', '{}', '[]'
codes.gg: go to the first line of the document
codes.G: go to the last line of the document
codes.fx: jump to next occurrence of character x
codes.tx: jump to before next occurrence of character x
codes.Fx: jump to previous occurence of character x
codes.Tx: jump to after previous occurence of character x
codes.;: repeat previous f, t, F or T movement
codes.,: repeat previous f, t, F or T movement, backwards
codes.}: jump to next paragraph (or function/block, when editing code)
codes.{: jump to previous paragraph (or function/block, when editing code)
codes.Ctrl + e: move screen down one line (without moving cursor)
codes.Ctrl + y: move screen up one line (without moving cursor)

codes.y s <motion> <desired>: Add desired surround around text defined by `motion`
codes.S <desired>: Surround when in visual modes (surrounds full selection)

codes.ea: insert (append) at the end of the word
codes.Ctrl + h: delete the character before the cursor during insert mode
codes.Ctrl + w: delete word before the cursor during insert mode
codes.Ctrl + j: begin new line during insert mode

codes.gu: change to lowercase up to motion
codes.gU: change to uppercase up to motion
codes.C: change (replace) to the end of the line
codes.cw: change (replace) to the end of the word
codes.S: delete line and substitute text (same as cc)

codes.\\vpattern: 'very magic' pattern: non-alphanumeric characters are interpreted as special regex symbols (no escaping needed)
codes.:%s/old/new/g: replace all old with new throughout file
codes.:%s/old/new/gc: replace all old with new throughout file with confirmations

codes.`\": go to the position when last editing this file
go to the position of the last change in this file
codes.``: go to the position before the last jump

codes.gc: toggles line comment. For example gcc to toggle line comment for current line and gc2j to toggle line comments for the current line and the next two lines.
codes.gC: toggles block comment. For example gCi) to comment out everything within parentheses.

codes.gd: toggles line comment. For example gcc to toggle line comment for current line and gc2j to toggle line comments for the current line and the next two lines.
codes.gb: toggles block comment. For example gCi) to comment out everything within parentheses.
codes.af: visual mode command which selects increasingly large blocks of text.
